pros: The company & management care about employees as a whole person.
cons: PTO plan is not as good as other companies.

pros: Work life balance, management, benefits, promotion & future growth opportunities
cons: Pay can be low unless negotiated

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Omaha, NE
pros: Immanuel Fontanelle/Newport House used to have a great culture. We used to provide exceptional care in a loving environment.
cons: Recently, our administrator decided to cut our staffing to unsafe ratios. He doesn’t care to listen to frustrated staff. All he seems to care about is money, not the decline in the quality of care we’re providing. We can’t keep the residents safe. We don’t have time to give baths, help residents eat, get everyone changed, or do half of the things the residents deserve. We work hard for very little pay & now they’re taking away our staff.

pros: Immanuel has a very positive and kind culture of inclusivity. Senior leadership is accessible and communicative. I have a work/life balance here that I have not experienced with other employers. Sometimes it is just the daily things like free beverages and friendly co-workers who can take the time to pause and help each other that make it a nice workplace.
cons: It took a minute for me to get used to the open work spaces, which has its pros and cons. Very collaborative at times and other times I use the private work spaces when I really need to focus.

pros: The DON Bianca is amazing and really trying to fix staffing which is a problem all over the world. She’s done an amazing job. Coworkers are extremely welcoming
cons: I don’t have a con for this company

job_title: Life Enrichment Coordinator in Pleasant Hill, IA
pros: Good benefits that most places don't have
cons: Lower pay for being non-profit

pros: There are none. Not enough staff, not enough equipment or supplies, but plenty of work and hours.
cons: Management does not care who is hired or who shows up. As long as a warm body is there, that’s all that matters. They can be horrible in resident care and speak no English.

pros: Best coworkers I’ve ever encountered. Work as a team and feel like my second family. Manager and director are involved of take staff suggestions serious.
cons: Staffing can be difficult at times but that’s healthcare these days.

pros: - Relatively easy work when compared to other CNA jobs
cons: - Doesn’t care about the residents they serve, only the bottom line. Can be emotionally draining in this regard

pros: Immanuel is overall a great company to work for. I started here right out of college and have loved getting to build relationships with residents and my co-workers. The benefits are pretty good as well.
cons: I don't feel that this position has given me an opportunity to grow within the company. They do offer tuition reimbursement program but as far as moving up within Immanuel that has been slim to none.

review_title: Great company if you like corporate environments
pros: Non-profit that takes great care of their employees.
cons: As they've grown, they've shifted focus from individualized communities to corporate standardization.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Omaha, NE
pros: Awesome co workers that are welling to help
cons: Managers lie. Pay is awful for the job. Some nurses are rude.

pros: Very little paperwork and you are not doing notes for an insurance company to pay.
cons: They are very direct and don't take any b.s. You really have to buy into their philosophy of #proudtoworkhere and if you don't you don't fit in. Also, as far a professionals that work there, there almost no men in their employment at a professional level.

job_title: Medicaid Coordinator in Des Moines, IA
pros: Great environment to be in
cons: Lot of duties for this role

pros: It has an amazing atmosphere
cons: It is a large building, it can get confusing

pros: Great company good benefits nice pay
cons: Dietary aids are drama queens

pros: This organization is committed to not only the people they serve, seniors, but also their employees.  This is the first company I have worked for where any employee could describe our mission statement to you and give an example as to how it was lived out that day--it isn't just a plaque on a wall.  Regardless of your field of expertise, there is probably a career available to you within this company.  They are changing the face of senior care and engage their employees in how to do this.  Career development opportunities are available and professional growth is encouraged as well with a generous tuition reimbursement amount.  while everyone wishes they could be paid more, our pay is competitive in our market and our benefits are great.  Love working for this company!
cons: If you like coming to work and every day is the same, this isn't the company for you.  We work with people and all of their uniqueness, making each day just a little bit different with brand new opportunities!

job_title: PC Support Technician in Omaha, NE
pros:
-Great wages
-Effective Team Communication
-Great benefits
-Plenty of PTO

You are given plenty of opportunities to excel in terms of learning through access to sites like Plural-sight and an education stipend so that you may continue your education.

Immanuel serves its residents, employees, and community with its CHRIST promises and it shows.  Immanuel has plenty of opportunities to connect with other co-workers and to serve our community.

I really feel like a part of the team here and I enjoy being able to represent a company that has values that I can stand behind.

I love working here!
cons: Some of the management is very hands off with the people they supervise, but if you enjoy creating your own work and not having to check-in all the time, maybe it wouldn't detract from working at Immanuel.

review_title: A company that is fueled by passion, setting high standards for participants and staff.
job_title: Activities Coordinator in Windsor Heights, IA
pros: Supportive team leaders, positive work environment, passionate employees, competitive wages, unbeatable benefits. Always working towards bettering the logistics of the business but keeping our participants number one.
cons: We are continually evolving and while I don’t believe this is a deterrent, we do have growing pains as we reconfigure and plan what’s best for our participants and staff.

review_title: Most Companies Talk, Few Actually Deliver -- Immanuel Delivers!
job_title: General Manager of Culinary Operations in Omaha, NE
pros: Improving purpose for employees with flexibility, career opportunities, great mission and adequate work-life balance. The ability to make large impacts with residents and improve a lifestyle of freedom, dignity, and independence. Immanuel is an organization which truly lives out its mission each day. Operations are strategized with the ability for new ideas being brought forth. Immanuel has a great culture, a lot of great team members and truly promotes longevity.
cons: I wish there was a bistro with hot options in the home office break room.

review_title: Better than working in a Restaurant!
job_title: Dining Room Manager in Omaha, NE
pros: Great hours, benefits that are always being reviewed and improved upon, very good general vibe of caring and kindness
cons: With all of the changes being made there have been some growing pains, and it is taking a minute for the company to get around to checking the market value of every position so some pay rates are not yet competitive.

job_title: Director of Strategic Projects in Omaha, NE
pros: Immanuel is about PEOPLE and serving EVERYONE.  Immanuel is a place to make a life long career!
cons: The only "Con" is I wish I had made the move to Immanuel sooner.

review_title: Happy and blessed to work for an organization that lives it's values
job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Omaha, NE
pros: Inspirational company values that I see walked out each day by staff and leadership. We get to serve seniors as they age with dignity and respect.  Immanuel is generous to its staff and to the community.
cons: Can't think of any cons

review_title: Dishwasher at The Landing, Lincoln, NE
pros: The staff is very friendly. Hours are flexible. Very good for a first job. Reasonable pay and a solid Christmas bonus. Good benefits (although I worked part-time so I didn't get many).
cons: The work is a bit monotonous. Can't take any tips from the residents. Some of the residents are mean. Have to work on weekends.

job_title: Certified Medication Aide in Omaha, NE
pros: Some really great coworkers and residents
cons: Management is getting worse and worse

pros: Create place - they care about their residents.  They put a lot of time and efforts to ensure they are doing the right thing.  People are great to work with here.  Everyone is willing to help out.
cons: Wish I came here earlier in my career.

pros:
People care for one another and they talk openly.  
Great location and the communities are very nicely done.
cons: Don't really have any - only been here 6 months

pros: Mission driven, growing nonprofit with a strong strategic plan. Great people, many opportunities to have an impact and career growth.
cons: None come to mind.

pros: Many of the persons working at Immanuel are very talented and are there to help the Senior community.
cons: There are several higher level managment persons who are running the company into the ground.

pros: Fair pay, generous PTO, benefits, great work/life balance for cooks (most shifts usually end by 7), multiple advancement opportunities, great work environment
cons: The hiring process can take awhile, but it IS worth the wait!
